metadata.title: CVE-2016-1677 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
uri.js in Google V8 before 5.1.281.26, as used in Google Chrome before51.0.2704.63, uses an incorrect array type, which allows remote attackersto obtain sensitive information by calling the decodeURI function andleveraging "type confusion."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
